summary: An email from attorney Jeffrey S. Pop to an unidentified recipient, forwarding a previous email sent in error to someone else and discussing how to proceed. The email contains a confidentiality notice indicating it may contain privileged attorney-client information.

persons.name: Jeffrey S. Pop
persons.context: Author of the email, an attorney at Jeffrey S. Pop & Associates, who mistakenly sent a previous email to the wrong person and is now contacting the intended recipient.

events.title: Email forwarding previous mistaken correspondence
events.description: Jeffrey S. Pop sends an email to an intended recipient, attaching a previous email he had mistakenly sent to someone else, and asks how to proceed.

keyFacts: Attorney Jeffrey S. Pop mistakenly sent a previous email to the wrong person and refers to that person by a mistaken name.
Pop is now contacting the intended recipient to determine how to proceed after the error.
The email contains a strong confidentiality notice, suggesting it may involve attorney-client privileged or work-product protected information.
